string.value: You ran into someone from the past who apparently knew you. Maybe #p2131000# in Ellin Forest knows something about the Seal Stone. You'd better go talk to #b#p2131000##k and find out.

#p2131000# says that she did store a rock in #m300000011#, which the heroes left for her, and says the rock might be the Seal Stone. Entering #m300000011# to verify whether the rock is actually a Seal Stone requires a #b#t4032325##k. #p2132000# in #b#m300010400##k apparently has it.\r\n\r\n#i4032325# #t4032325# #b#c4032325# / 1#k
You received the #t4032325# from #p2132000#. #p2131000# told you to head to the #m300000011#.
Wait, but this is no longer your world. Are you here to recover bits and pieces of your past?\n#b#L0#(You tell her about the Seal Stone.)#l\n#k

...Seal Stone? I…don't remember. You guys did a lot of things, so there was no way I could keep up with it all. You did leave me with a piece of rock... Could that be the Seal Stone? It's a transparent rock...\n#b#L0#I think it is.#l\n#k

That? I'm storing it at the #b#m300000011##k. The #b#m300000011##k is locked so that we won't ever lose the valuable pieces of knowledge we have stored in there. #p2132000# is in charge of the #b#t4032325##k. Would you like to head over there and take it?
I'm sorry, Aran. I'd love to go there myself, but I can't leave this post. You'll find #b#p2132000##k if you exit to the left and continue going west all the way to the #bBoulder Mountain Entrance#k.
I'm sorry, Aran. I'd like to go there myself, but I can't leave this post. And it's not like I have a spare key…
You managed to get the #t4032325# from #p2132000#. Now, can you give me the keys? I'll leave #m300000011# open.
The library can be accessed using the #bportal right above me#k. I left it open, so just go ahead and check it out.
You still haven't brought back the #b#t4032325##k? You'll find #b#p2132000##k at #b#m300010400##k located on the outskirts west of town. Get the keys from him.
